70669046.review:
Mass Effect 2 is the sequel to Mass Effect and is debatably one of the greatest games Bioware ever made. To me, ME2 represents a perfect sequel to an already really solid RPG. 

ME2 takes place shortly after the events of the first, with Commander Shepard killed in action and then subsequently resurrected by the human group Cerberus. Who needs him to destroy a new enemy called the Collectors. While the main plot to ME2 is surprisingly disconnected to the events of ME1 and ME3, that's not entirely where the story ends. To destroy the Collectors Shepard needs to recruit a group of mercenaries for a suicide mission. Which is what you spend the bulk of the game doing.

The game excels at this aspect, recruiting people for a suicide mission. All of the mercenaries you recruit are genuinely memorable characters, and all with the exception of the two DLC characters have additional quests associated with them. The stand-outs are Tali and Garrus who reappear from the first game and developed since then. I genuinely love how the plot of this game is structured into tons of small side stories that allow you to just explore this galaxy. Many of the locations in the game such as Omega and Tuchanka really stand out. It feels so good to just live in this universe and experience these characters and it scratches an itch other RPGs really don't think about scratching. It genuinely feels like a game that rewards multiple playthroughs and playing through the original several times.

The gameplay to ME2 and the general aesthetic was altered. The game is much darker and contrasts with ME1's primarily blue color pallet with a more black and orange one. This allows the game to stand out considerably in comparison to ME1 and ME3 (Which both visually resemble each other closer). The gameplay was also much more streamlined and focused into an action title. This was liked and disliked by players at the time. Most players really enjoyed that the clunkier combat was made better but other players disliked the rpg elements were essentially dumbed down. Personally I didn't mind the new combat and I liked they focused the game on it.

It's really hard for me to pick favourites out of the entire trilogy but easily the game I played the most was ME2, I loved this game when it originally released. And I still love it now. And I hope if you choose to pick it up, you'll learn to really enjoy it too.

70337030.review:
The fight against the Reapers continues. Mass Effect 2 takes you into darkness with a starting twist that will set the second game apart from the first one, but I'll get into that part eventually. As you gather a ragtag group of old friends, mercenaries, and criminals, the clock is constantly ticking towards doomsday on humanity. A new threat called the Collectors is invading and abducting human colonies. In Mass Effect 2, the brutal and vicious organization called Cerberus that you encounter in the first game will be your ally (?) in the fight against the Collectors.

As far as the narrative goes, the game did a really impressive job. Every mission was engaging, tense, and frightening. It's so immersive that you can literally feel that the stake is so high. Such as the disturbing ambiance in the Collector ship really makes you want to rip your skin off... or even flying your ship into the Omega 4 Relay as you wonder whether you and your companions will survive the journey or not. I mean the fate of humanity and the galaxy is literally in your hands, so no big deal.

All of these makes Mass Effect 2 really stand out as a video game and why it was such a big deal. I love the game but I hated how different the devs are approaching ME2 compared to the first one.

One of my (personal) problems is that planetary exploration is less present. I miss the sense of wonder and mystery while exploring the galaxy in ME. Granted, there's the Reaper problem that we have to solve. Oh and then there is my second problem. I just really wish we could get to know more about their background here rather than a DLC from ME3.

The customization is also an issue for me. I'm pissed off when I found out in-game that this feature from ME is more limited in ME2. The gameplay and combat are a step up from ME but you can see how it focuses more on being a shooter here than an RPG.

Mass Effect 2 is an amazing game and experience. I'm probably in the minority but these are just issues that some people would probably not care about. The game is so worth playing!

Although I am unimpressed by less RPG and more action-oriented gameplay, this title shines in dealing with interpersonal relationships. A simple overarching plot with lame, uninspired tropes doesn't stop the fun of building an A-team to go on a glorious suicide mission. "Show, don't tell." The "Illusive man," really? Show the political intrigue and fallout from this guy rather than outright call it out. Cerberus in the first game was mysterious with a grey morality rather than just "mysterious bad people." Overall, the first Mass Effect was a better game, but #2 makes up for it with great gun-play, graphics, friendships and romances with NPCs. In a word, Mass Effect 2 suffers from bad macro writing, but excels at micro writing. 
Graphics 5/5, Story 4/5, Gameplay 4/5.
Also EA sucks.

69832660.review:
I have owned this game for many years, but only now have a gotten around to giving a review. This is more for people who are just now considering getting the game but unsure after all these years, rather than just purely a recommendation.

This game is truly one of the best games to ever exist, not only was it a milestone for RPG's and shooters alike, but the story is a magnum Opus against other games, putting old and modern storylines to shame. For reference, this is my favourite game/trilogy to ever exist, and it would take a feat to top it even after 10 years of its existence.

This game is perfect for all preferences. Its combat is stellar giving you many different options not only for weapons but classes, combat styles, companions, actions and exploration, but if the fighting isn't the main draw to you, then you are greeted with hundreds of story beats, options you can take that directly impact the ending, side characters in which every one is fleshed out to perfection, thousands of NPC's which have missions and personalities. I have played this game more times than you can imagine, and even now I still find new things that I didn't know existed in my last playthrough.

The only downfall to this game, is the one with most of the 'not recommended' comments address, which is the fact that DLC's do need to be paid for if you want them (And the deluxe version is missing one DLC I believe) however, this game is completely playable without them and aren't essential at all.

I could sit here a gush for hours about how brilliant this game is, however we only have so much time. Don't get put off by the age of the game, or the fact that you are late to it. In my opinion, age doesn't matter, because this trilogy is truly timeless. Take my word for it, you will never looks back.

69669237.review:
A solid game in the trilogy of Shepard fighting back against the collectors.

Different classes are fun, the option of being paragon/renegade makes it so you have to consider what you're saying to unlock future conversation options.

The installation of Cerberus DLC is a pain, but simple YouTube tutorial sorted this for me.
Pick this game up, and import your save to ME3 to continue your barrage of Biotics against the Reapers.

69666472.review: This is Bioware's magnum opus. With fantastic and lurid gameplay, interactive storytelling with choices that deeply matter, an incredible cast of characters, deep and complex lore, incredible graphics, combined with one of the greatest final missions ever in gaming, this is not only one of the best games of the 21st century, but it's also one of the greatest games ever created. 10/10

Voy a ser breve, mejora en todo de largo al primer juego y creo que ha envejecido bastante mejor, muy entretenido y divertido. Las unicas pegas que le veo son:

1: la misión secundaria "lanzamiento de los misiles jabalina" crashea al llegar a cierto punto, con lo que aconsejo saltarsela.
2: en varias sitios me he topado con que me acerco a cajas, rocas y cosas asi y el personaje se queda como subido encima bugeado o bien se queda como flotando y anda en el aire, con lo que toca cargar partida y segun en que momento puede mosquear bastante. Lo bueno que son en puntos concretos no aleatorios, asi que los evitas y ya esta, pero en un juego de este calibre y los años que tiene deberia estar solucionado.
